page.title: 09FARMING
page.content: The coastal plain around Alness is fairly flat with fertile soils . This combined with a favourable climate, annual precipitation under 750mm., makes the area well suited for arable farming. The main crops are spring and winter barley,wheat and potatoes; grass is grown to provide hay and silage for winter feeding. Increasing quantities of oil-seed rape are being grown because of E.E.C. pricing policies. In winter sheep from nearby hill farms are brought down to the sheltered lowland where most of the lambing takes place.The main farm within the study area,Dalmore Farm, also breeds horses. Most lambs and calves produced locally are sold at Dingwall or Inverness.
